dialogues.text: There is a broad grin on his face. Then he and Price move out of the barrack, quickly. As they go out the door --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling off, with  phony efficiency) Air raid! Air raid! Everybody in the  trenches!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now the barrack is empty. Except for one thing: from behi one of the rear bunks, Sefton steps out. He puts a cigar his mouth, lights it. There is a gleam in his eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ach so-o-o-o!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The phonograph, on the center table, is playing: I Love Y About a dozen P.O.W.s are dancing with each other, among  them, Triz, leading Harry, Blondie, leading a bearded P.O The whole thing is very elegant, with new guys cutting in politely. One of the P.O.W.s sings into a mike, consistin of a stick stuck into a knothole in the table with a tin on top.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So it got to be Christmas Day in  Stalag 17. As it turned out, it was  more like the Fourth of July -- with  all the fireworks that were to go  off all at once and bust the camp  wide open. It sure started off  innocently enough, with a party going  on in every barracks...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sefton, propped up in his bunk, is watching the proceedin In back of him, against the window, sits Cookie. Sefton's eyes never leave -- Price, who is near the phonograph with Pirelli and anothe P.O.W. They are supplying a makeshift jazz accompaniment, playing on a washboard, drumming on the table and strummi a bass fiddle string attached to a bucket. Sefton. There is a look of cynical amusement on his face he takes this in. A P.O.W. tags Triz to cut in. Harry holds out his arms. H is ready. But the P.O.W. dances off with Triz, leaving Ha flat. Harry looks over to Stosh. Stosh lies in his bunk, drinking what's left of the booze swiped from the distillery. He is staring at the pin-ups Grable pasted on the ceiling of his bunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Animal -- let's trip the  light fantastic!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're crying, Animal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's that song, Harry!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (seeing the pin-up) You don't want to cry over a dame  that doesn't even know you're alive!  Snap out of it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a time in every man's life  when he wants to be alone! So go  away!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes another swig and lets down the big pin-up so it  hangs a few inches in front of his eyes. Harry turns away from Stosh, picks up a pilot cap, turns inside out so the yellow fur shows on top, puts it on. He gets some straw out of a hole in a mattress and tucks it  under the cap like curls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, boys, who wants the Queen  of the May?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A P.O.W. drops his partner and dances Harry off. Sefton, in his bunk, watching Price all the time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any cigars left, Cookie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No answer from Cookie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Cookie. Get me a cigar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cookie doesn't move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter? You on their team  now? You think I'm the guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sefton goes to the raided footlocker for a last tattered  cigar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand how you feel, Cookie.  It's sort of rough -- one American  squealing on other Americans. Then  again, Cookie -- maybe that stoolie's  not an American at all. Maybe he's a  German the Krauts planted in this  barracks. They do this type of thing.  Just put an agent in with us -- a  trained specialist. Lots of loose  information floating around a prison  camp. Not just whether somebody wants  to escape, but what outfits we were  with and where we were stationed,  and how our radar operates. Could  be, couldn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In this barracks?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not? Just one of the boys. Sharing  our bunks. Eating our chow. Right in  amongst the ones that beat me up.  Except that he beat hardest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not the point, Cookie. The  point is what do you do with him?  You tip your mitt and the Jerries  pull him out of here and plant him  someplace else, like Stalag Sixteen  or Fifteen. Or you kill him off and  the Krauts turn around and kill off  the whole barracks. Every one of us.  So what do you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sefton doesn't answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you don't want to tell me, why  don't you tell Hoffy? Or Security?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Security.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He just sits there, smoking and looking in the direction Price at the middle table. Bagradian steps up to Price, w is busy beating out the rhythm. The P.O.W. is no longer  singing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Hoffy? Why don't we get any  news about Dunbar?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry. He'll be all right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had to be the ham! I had to shoot  off my mouth!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it. He'll be back here. They've  got no proof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry seats himself on the table, tossing his curls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the rhythm boys) Sweet and soft, boys. Beguile me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stosh in his bunk. He drains the booze from the jar, look out at the room through tear blurred eyes. He sees: Harry sitting on the table, listening to the music. He is the identical pose Betty Grable has struck in the big pin photo. Stosh's eyes go back to the big pin-up photo. He looks ba at: Harry. By now it is not Harry who is sitting there. It is Betty Grable, or rather the pin-up photo superimposed in same size as Harry. Stosh blinks his eyes. He stares some more. Delirious  happiness dawns on his face. He climbs out of his bunk an walks toward Harry, in a trance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself) Betty!... Betty!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He has reached the table, bows politely to Harry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I have this dance, Miss?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why, sure!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He climbs off the table. Stosh puts his arm around very  elegantly and dances him off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who would've ever thought I'd be  holding you in my arms?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A peculiar expression comes over Harry's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pinch me, will you? Pinch me so I'll  know I'm not dreaming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry reaches up and pinches him heartily on the cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, darling!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again, a reaction from Harry as they dance on. Stosh sing few bars of I Love You with the record. His cheek is very close to Harry. He is lost in blissful romance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did anybody ever tell you you have  the most beautiful legs in the world?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry does a big take.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it's not just those legs. It's  that nose of yours I'm crazy about.  That cute little button of a nose!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (the situation begins  to seep through) Hey, Animal! Animal!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sweeping on madly) I've been crazy about you for years.  I've seen every picture you've ever  made six times. I'd just sit there  and never even open that popcorn  bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (breaking from him) Animal! Animal! Wake up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts slapping his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Betty! Betty!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taking off his wig) This is me, Animal! It's Harry  Shapiro!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stosh stares at him. The truth dawns on him. He starts ba like a child. Hoffy hurries in from the compound. He is followed by Duk Marko and The Crutch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cut that music! Cut it! Listen!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All turn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The S.S. Men are here to pick up  Dunbar. They're taking him to Berlin.  Looks like he's finished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only he ain't quite finished yet.  Blondie -- get that smudge pot. Tie  it to Steve's leg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blondie gets the can of smoke-powder and, as the scene  progresses, fastens it in The Crutch's empty pants' leg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you going to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want everybody out of here. We'll  need a lot of commotion on the  compound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll get the men from the other  barracks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Hoffy) You don't think you can snatch Dunbar?  Not from the S.S.?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're sure going to make a stab at  it. You, Price and Stosh and Harry  and Blondie -- be at the north  latrine. You'll all get your posts.  Now everybody start drifting out  with Marko.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy, boys, easy. Disperse out there  nicely and always remember just  because the Krauts are dumb that  doesn't make them stupid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men start filing out through both doors quietly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Blondie) Ready?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Price, Stosh,  Harry and Duke) Okay. Move on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Crutch, Blondie, Harry and Stosh leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what your scheme is,  but it sounds crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe it's crazy, but it's better  than having Dunbar dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just as you say, Hoffy. But wouldn't  it be smarter if I went out and kept  Schulz tied up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (moving in) I wouldn't worry about Schulz. I'd  worry about Sefton. Remember me? I'm  the stoolie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ain't going to squeal this one,  brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No? Aren't you a little afraid to  turn the stoolie loose on that  compound? For a tip-off like this,  you know what the Krauts would pay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll stay in this barracks and not  a peep out of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, then. Put a guard on me. I  want you to put a guard on me. Because  if anything goes wrong out there,  this time you won't have a patsy.  Right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So who stays with me? Maybe Joey? No --  not Joey. Wouldn't you feel safer  with Security on the job?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, Price. You stay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Schulz?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll take care of Schulz. (to the others) Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all follow Hoffy out, leaving Price and Sefton. They stand for a while looking at each other. From OFF co some WEIRD NOTES on the ocarina. Joey sits in his bunk, playing on his new sweet potato.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the boy, Joey. Play us a little  something. What do you want to hear,  Price? Home On The Range? Or maybe a  little Wagner?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No answer from Price.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or how about a game of pinochle? No,  you're not a pinochle man. You're a  chess player. (moves to chess board) I haven't played since I was a kid.  Let's see -- (maneuvers the white  pieces) -- a pawn moves this way, doesn't  it? And a bishop this way? And the  queen -- every which way, doesn't  it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suppose you just sit down and keep  your mouth shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (moving about) I went to school with a guy named  Price. But that was in Boston. You're  from Cleveland, aren't you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I'm from Cleveland.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought that's what you said. You're  from Cleveland. And you were with  the Thirty-sixth Bomb Group?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thirty-fifth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three hundred and sixty-fifth Bomb  Squadron? Out of Chelveston?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you questioning me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just getting acquainted. Trying to  make one friend in this barracks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't bother, Sefton. I don't like  you. I never did and I never will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lot of people say that and the  first thing you know is they get  married and live happily ever after. (goes to window) I wonder what they're trying to pull  out there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several hundred P.O.W.s are casually strolling about the  compound. The CAMERA MOVES TOWARDS the Administration Bui PAST an S.S. car parked on the roadway, with the motor  running. An S.S. driver stands at the car door. Harry and Stosh stand by the car, inspecting it. CAMERA MOVES ON PA the flagpole, against which leans Duke, and ON TO the por of the Administration Building: there stands Hoffy, readi the bulletin board. Only he isn't reading it. From one co of his eye he is peeking through the window into the  Kommandant's office. Suddenly he reacts to a movement ins Without turning, he gives the signal: he throws one end o his muffler around his neck. Duke, at the flagpole, gets it and throws his muffler aro his neck, thusly relaying the signal. At the car, Harry follows suit. Marko, leaning against the north latrine, catches the sig and, still facing the compound, RAPS with his knuckles on the wooden boards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Crutch is sitting on the wash trough. On hearing the  RAPS, Bagradian pulls up The Crutch's loose pants' leg.  Blondie strikes a match and lights the fuse on the smudge pot. Bagradian pulls down the pants' leg. They help The C off the wash trough and he hobbles out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Crutch is slowly hobbling toward the car, a thin wisp smoke curling up from his pants' leg. Out of the Administration Building emerge two S.S. Men,  leading Dunbar between them. Hoffy, standing at the bulle board, WHISTLES a few bars of the Air Force song. Dunbar  turns, sees Hoffy whistling. Hoffy doesn't look at him, b Dunbar senses that something is in the wind. He walks on  between the S.S. Men. As he is being led toward the car,  still some thirty feet away, P.O.W.s crowd in to watch hi The Crutch, hobbling on from the direction of the latrine is some twenty feet from the car. Duke straightens up from the flagpole casually, and start sauntering toward the car. The latrine. Blondie and Bagradian have moved out of the  latrine and stand there with Marko, watching the car. Harry and Stosh at the car. Stosh tightening the belt of coat, Harry pulling the barracks cap tight on his head. The driver of the car opens the door. The S.S. Men and Du are some eight feet away now. The Crutch, hobbling past the car, releases a string and smudge pot drops as he moves on. He barely makes it. Almo instantly, there is a belch of fire and smoke starts pour out of the smoke bomb. The wind billows the smoke across the car, rapidly envelo the S.S. Men and Dunbar. There are German SHOUTS from wit the smoke cloud. Duke, Harry, Stosh, Blondie, Bagradian, Marko and Hoffy m into the smoke from all sides. All now is lost in smoke.  Just silhouettes of men rushing about. SHOUTS, German  commands, SOUNDS of scuffling. From OFF a siren starts to sound. German guards come running from all corners of the compound into the cloud. In the goon towers, the guards wheel around their machine guns, but don't dare to shoot into the smoke. From the Administration Building storms von Scherbach,  followed by the two Lieutenants, Schulz and other guards. They dash into the smoke cloud, which starts lifting.

dialogues.speaker: THE COMPOUND
dialogues.text: The smoke cloud starts to clear. At the car, the two S.S. Men and the driver stand with guns in their hands. Dunbar gone. The other P.O.W.s stand around innocently. Von Sche is screaming his head off, but his words are not heard. C PULLS BACK INTO Barracks 4, revealing Sefton and Price at the window. Sefton turns from the window, a little smile his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ach so!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amazing, what you can do with five  thousand ping-pong balls, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Price is pacing. Joey starts tootling again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Joey) Stop that, will you! (to Sefton) Those idiots! So they sprang Dunbar!  So what good is it? He's still in  the compound, isn't he? How long can  he last? Where can they hide him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where. Up Joey's ocarina. Didn't you  know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Price looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the P.O.W.s are formed into a line that serpentines t a desk set up on the porch of the Administration Building Light machine guns have been set up around them, the guar watching carefully. Behind the desk sit the two German  Lieutenants, and in back of them stands Schulz. Every P.O as he passes, is screened by the Lieutenants, then dogtag and faces being checked against an index of cards and  photographs on the desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah? Where did we hide him? Nobody  knew that except Hoffy -- not one of  us -- and he wouldn't talk. It sure  drove the Krauts crazy looking for  Dunbar. They herded us all out into  the compound and put some extra  machine guns on us and gave us the  old picture check. You know, checking  our dogtags and our pans...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pirelli, Blondie, Hoffy and Duke file by. The next in lin is Price, followed by Sefton. As Price is being checked, eyes meet Schulz's. Schulz looks at him inquisitively. Th only answer on Price's face for a split second is: "I don know". But he's got to watch himself as he is followed by Sefton. A barracks: Guards with dogs are searching under it. Another barracks: German guards throw tear gas bombs into and close the doors. The compound. All the P.O.W.s are now lined up in long li facing the Administration Building. Von Scherbach, standi on the porch flanked by the S.S. Men, his Lieutenants and Schulz, lets go with a tirade. THE CAMERA SWOOPS BACK fro his face over the lined-up P.O.W.s all the way to the sou latrine and UP AND OVER the water tank. As it now PANS IN the water tank, we see Dunbar. He is hiding in the water  tank, up to his knees in icy water. He is weak and drawn he has to hold on not to collapse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...against their index file. They  searched under the barracks. They  searched the roofs. They even searched  the bathroom in the Kommandant's  office, but no Dunbar. Then they  tried to smoke him out, throwing  tear gas bombs into every barracks,  just in case he was hiding up in the  rafters. Then they made us stand for  six hours out there until finally  von Scherbach came out and gave us  his ultimatum: if Dunbar didn't come  out by next morning he'd raze the  whole lous; compound, stick by stick  and if we'd sleep in the mud for the  rest of our lives, that was okay by  him. I thought he'd bust his gut the  way he was screaming. He just couldn't  figure how a guy could disappear  from the compound and still be there,  but Dunbar was there all right. He  sure was there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the goon towers lights are sweeping over the compoun the dark barracks and the barbed wire fences.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was there for half the night, his  feet right in the icy water. That's  tough to take, especially when you  got three heated pools at home. It  took a lot of guts, the kind you'd  expect from a sergeant -- but a  lieutenant --!

dialogues.speaker: WATER TANK
dialogues.text: Dunbar, exhausted, is clinging desperately to the ladder  inside the tank, his feet in the icy water. Over the tank sweeps the light from a goon tower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Hundefuehrer is leading his dogs past the dark barrac Not a sound from within.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blankets are hanging over the windows. On the center tabl burns a margarine lamp. All the men from Barracks 4 are  gathered around the table. All except Joey and Sefton. In the center of the table is one of the P.O.W.s' cap. The m one by one, are dropping their dogtags into it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (putting in his own  dogtag) Let's have it understood men -- this  is going to be a rough deal. But we  have no choice. One of us must take  Dunbar out of the camp tonight. Right  away. We'll draw one dogtag and the  guy who goes with it does the job.  It's going to be rough because the  Krauts have put on extra guards and  they are expecting a move like this.  So if anyone wants to withdraw, he  better speak up now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks around. Nobody moves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then we're all in on it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody but Joey, and you know  who.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They shoot a look towards Sefton. Sefton stands leaning  against his bunk. He looks right back at them. Back at the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. (with irony) Who's the lucky one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shakes the dogtags in the cap. Everyone crowds around, tensely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me do it, Hoffy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I want to draw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right. (holding out cap) Draw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry closes his eyes, puts his hand deep into the cap an picks out a tag. But before anybody can look at it, Price closes his fist over it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suppose we call this my tag. I'll  take him out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men turn toward Price.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No volunteers, Price. I said we're  all in on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have elected me Security. The  way things have been going in this  Barracks, I guess I've done a poor  job and I want to make up for it. Is  that asking too much?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sefton, standing against the bunk, takes it in with a gri smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've all done a poor job of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I still say this is my tag. Any  objections, Hoffy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any objections, men?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not from me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He can have it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Stosh) Who are we to argue with a hero?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about me latching on, Price?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three's a crowd, especially if you've  got to cut your way through barbed  wire. (hands Price wire  cutters) Here's the wire cutters. (to Blondie) Are the civilian clothes ready?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stuffing clothes  into duffel bag) Coming up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Harry and Stosh) Get going on the trap door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They move to the old trap door and start unscrewing it. P goes to his bunk, Hoffy with him. Price starts putting on his jacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you say, Hoffy. We'll hit  the air raid trenches and cut out in  back of Barracks nine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd better cut out in back of the  south latrine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why the south latrine?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because that's where he is. In the  water tank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Price takes it smoothly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good spot. With any luck we'll make  Krems by morning, or maybe even catch  a barge to Linz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sefton, who has been watching closely, tosses two packs o cigarettes on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two packs of cigarettes say Dunbar  never gets out of the compound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You starting that again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anybody cover?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all look at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from the trap door) Somebody step on that crumb!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We warned you, Sefton!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure you warned me. You were going  to slit the throat of that stoolie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He throws an open jack-knife onto the table. The blade st The knife quivers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's the knife to do it with. Only  make sure you got the right throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're looking at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Harry and Stosh) Hurry up on that trap. (to Sefton) What are you trying to do, Sefton?  Gum up the works?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. Or would you rather  see Dunbar lying out there in the  mud tomorrow morning like Manfredi  and Johnson?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Sefton, I had my hands full so  they wouldn't tear you apart --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I called it the last time, didn't I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are we going to stand around here  and listen to him until the Germans  find out where Dunbar is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Germans know where Dunbar is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do they know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You told them, Hoffy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who did?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You off your rocker?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-huh. Fell right on my head. (confronting Price) Sprechen sie deutsch?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I don't sprechen sie deutsch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe just one word? Kaput? Because  you're kaput, Price.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you get this guy out of my hair  so I can go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go where? To the Kommandant's office  and tell him where Dunbar is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (starting for him) I'll kill you for that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up! (slaps his face) Security Officer, eh? Screening  everybody, only who screened you?  Great American hero. From Cleveland,  Ohio! Enlisted right after Pearl  Harbor! When was Pearl Harbor, Price?  Or, don't you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: December seventh, forty-one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Six o'clock. I was having dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Six o'clock in Berlin. They were  having lunch in Cleveland. (to the others) Am I boring you, boys?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a Nazi, Price is. For all I  know, his name is Preismaier or  Preissinger. Sure, he lived in  Cleveland, but when the war broke  out he came back to the Fatherland  like a good little Bundist. He spoke  our lingo so they put him through  spy school, gave him phony dogtags --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's lying! He's just trying to get  himself off the hook!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (jabbing him) Shut up, he said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You heard him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, Herr Preismaier, let's have  the mail box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The one you took out of the corner  of your bunk and put in this pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He snatches a black queen out of Price's coat pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now let me show you how they did it.  They did it by mail. That's right.  Little love notes between our Security  Officer and von Scherbach with Schulz  the mail man. (ties up a loop in  the light cord) Here's the flag. (opening a black queen) And here's the mail box. (grins at Price, who  is sweating) Cute, isn't it? They delivered the  mail or picked it up when we were  out of the barracks, like for Appell.  When there was a special delivery,  they'd pull a phony air raid to get  us out of here, like for instance,  last night. (to Price again) There wasn't a plane in the sky --  or was there, Price?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Price dives for the open trap door. He is caught by Duke. breaks away and flings himself at the window, tearing dow the blanket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screaming) Hilfe!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He never gets the whole word out. Stosh and Harry jump hi Stosh clamping his hand over his mouth. They throw him to the floor and all duck as the light from the goon tower s through the barracks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Hundefuehrer, leading the dogs past Barracks Nine. Th dogs sense something, and bark. The Hundefuehrer looks ar The dogs calm down and the Hundefuehrer goes on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody is petrified. The barking dies down. Blondie an Triz hang the blanket again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (indicating Price) Gag him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two P.O.W.s move in and take over. Duke moves up to Sefton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brother, were we all wet about you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (putting a cigar butt  into his mouth) Forget it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He strikes a match on Duke's stubbled cheek and lights th cigar. It doesn't hurt Duke a bit. He just stands there w a broad grin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (indicating Price) What are we going to do with him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you know? Because I got my own  ideas. (to Blondie) Let's have that civilian stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blondie gives him the barracks bag. Sefton opens it, take out a Tyrolean hat, puts it on. It is too small.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll look pretty stupid in this,  yodelling my way over those Alps.  Now let's have the wire cutters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pirelli takes them out of Price's belt and gives them to  him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You taking Dunbar?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You betcha. There ought to be some  reward money from Mama. Say ten  thousand bucks worth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts putting on his jacket and his cap, the eyes of  every P.O.W. in the barracks on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you boys I'm no escape artist,  but for the first time, I like the  odds. Because now I got me a decoy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the decoy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Price. When I go I want you to give  me five minutes. Exactly five minutes  to get Dunbar out of that water tank.  Then you throw Price out into the  compound, nice and loud. He'll draw  every light from every goon tower.  It's our only chance to cut through.  What do you say, Barracks' Chief?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shoot!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Price squirms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter, Price? You said  you were going to save Dunbar, didn't  you? So now, you're getting your  chance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sefton has picked up the barracks bag and the wire cutter and moves toward the trap door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So long, Cookie. The department store  is all yours. What's left of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So long, Sefton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not disposing of those Russian  broads?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell you what to do. First, get  yourself a hundred cigarettes for  the Kraut guards. Then get yourself  another face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could use a new one yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's synchronize the watches. Eleven  forty-two, sharp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (adjusting his) Check.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He climbs down into the open trap. All the men crowd arou to say goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One more word. If I ever run into  any of you bums on a street corner,  just let's pretend we never met  before. Understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes the cigar butt out of his mouth, puts it into Du half-open mouth -- and goes. There is a moment of silence

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This barracks will never be the same.

dialogues.speaker: UNDERNEATH BARRACK 4
dialogues.text: Sefton is crawling cautiously in the direction of the lat Behind him, the trap door is being fitted into the floor  again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sefton has crawled to the edge of the barracks, waits for light to swoop by. Then he dashes into the latrine just i time to evade another searchlight from a goon tower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sefton recovers his breath, listens for a second, then cl up on the wash trough. He raps on the bottom of the water tank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dunbar, utterly exhausted, is clinging to the ladder, his legs submerged in the icy water. He hears the signal. The is a flicker in his eyes. He hears another signal. With h last strength, he climbs the ladder, waits for a light to swoop by, then works himself over the top.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sefton has climbed on a beam above the wash trough. Dunba legs come down, dripping wet. Sefton gets hold of them, t as Dunbar lets go above, he takes his full weight and low him to the wash trough. Dunbar lies there, gasping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut off the moaning, or we'll have  the dogs on us. Shut it off,  Lieutenant. This is orders!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My legs are frozen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rubbing his legs  down) You'd better get that blue blood  circulating, because we're busting  out of this stink-hole in exactly -- (looks at watch) -- one minute and twenty seconds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking up) Sefton!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you expect, a St. Bernard  dog?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What some brandy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who doesn't! Suppose we wait until  we hit the Waldorf Astoria.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's on me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You won't get off that cheap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are the chances busting out of  here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at his watch) We'll know in forty seconds. (then with a grin) Only in a democracy can a poor guy  get his keister shot off with a rich  guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hoffy stands looking at his watch. Blondie is crossing wi the breadknife in his hand towards the door. Stosh and Du hold the gagged Price down on the bunk. Harry has strung  together some five old cans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the bearded P.O.W.) Hold his leg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The P.O.W. sits on Price's leg. Harry starts tying the ti cans to his ankle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Price) Just in case your Kameraden are hard  of hearing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fifteen seconds. Get him up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stosh and Duke pull Price up off the bunk and move him to the door. He struggles and squirms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop shaking, Price. There'll be no  pardon from no governor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Price) Funny, ain't it? In your own Vaterland --  by your own Soldaten! (to Stosh) The kid's got no sense of humor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter with you, Security?  You were always so calm. Especially  when you let Manfredi and Johnson go  out there. (to Blondie) Open the hatch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blondie has inserted the breadknife in the crack of the d He now whips up the knife with a sharp movement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bar across the door swivels up. The door is flung ope from inside. Duke and Stosh hold Price. Hoffy tears the g off his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let 'er go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duke and Stosh have lifted Price with all their might, an give him a terrific heave. As Price comes flying out into the compound, the tin cans clattering, the door is slamme shut. A light from a goon tower swings sharply to Price and hol him in its beam. A burst of machine gun fire splatters ar him. He scrambles to his feet, screaming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Schiesst nicht! Schiesst nicht! Ich  bin ein Deutscher!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His words are drowned out by more machine gun fire. He tr to run back towards his barracks, but is cut off by anoth beam and more machine gun fire from another goon tower. H runs madly into the dark compound, the tin cans clatterin behind him -- lights from all the goon towers searching f him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sefton and Dunbar stand at the door of the latrine,  searchlights swinging in arcs toward the compound. Sefton holds the wire-cutters in his hand. There is the clatter the tin cans and machine gun fire, and Price's desperate  screams, "Nicht schiessen! Nicht schiessen!".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They duck out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sefton and Dunbar dash across the short stretch to the ba wire. They fall on their faces at the wire and Sefton sta cutting. Price. A machine gun bullet has struck him in the shoulde He desperately tries to evade the relentless light beams. manages to tear off the tin cans, runs on towards the  Administration Building. A couple of more bullets hit him He falls face down into the mud. All the lights converge him and the machine guns sputter away.

dialogues.speaker: BARBED WIRE
dialogues.text: Sefton is just cutting through the outer fence. In back o him, Dunbar patches the cut wire of the inner fence. Beyo them, all the lights play on the body of Price. The machi guns are no longer shooting, but there are whistles and a siren. The barking dogs tear into Price's body. Sefton and Dunbar crawl through the outer wire and pause patch it up hastily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's blow, Chauncey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They get to their feet and scramble off into the forest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Von Scherbach comes striding out of the Administration  Building followed by a Lieutenant, the two S.S. Men and  Schulz. He wades cockily through the mud with his beautif boots towards the body on the ground. The Hundefueher cal off his dogs. The other guards step back. With his boot, Scherbach flips the body over. The lights from the goon t play on the muddy face of Price. They all stand there stu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lamps are being put out; the blankets being pulled do by the P.O.W.s.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, men. Everybody back in  their bunks like nothing happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They climb into their bunks. All is still.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (puffing Sefton's  cigar) What do you know? The crud did it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like to know what made him do  it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe he just wanted to steal our  wire cutters. Ever think of that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cookie, in his bunk, a broad smile on his face, starts  whistling softly: When Johnny Comes Marching Home. Beyond him lie all the P.O.W.s in the barracks, their hearts bea their eyes wide open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sefton and Dunbar climb swiftly up a hill through the tre Dunbar's arm is over Sefton's shoulder as they march. OVE THIS, Cookie's whistling of Johnny Comes Marching Home -- gradually augmented by drums and then an orchestra. Sefto and Dunbar march on, in time to the music. SUPERIMPOSED BEYOND THEM appear the other P.O.W.s from St 17, their spirits marching with them through the forest. in front, Stosh in his underwear, waving a makeshift flag Then comes Harry. Then Cookie. Then Triz and Blondie. The Joey, playing his ocarina in tune with the march, a smile his face. And Marko and The Crutch. Then Hoffy and Duke, all the others we have grown to know. All waving their  pathetic flags: towels, blankets and torn shirts. All mar to freedom and home, marching with Sefton and Dunbar. As MUSIC SWELLS to a crescendo --
